newsitem.title: CHILE: Chuquicamata supervisors unlikely to strike - source.
newsitem.headline: Chuquicamata supervisors unlikely to strike - source.

text.p: Supervisors at Chilean state copper company Codelco's Chuquicamata pit are likely to accept the firm's pay offer in a vote next week and not go on strike, said a source close to the collective talks.
"The signals from the company are good. A strike is unlikely but there's always the danger something could change in coming days," the source told Reuters.
Talks are concentrating on several points including health benefits and bonuses, he said.
Codelco is due to make its final offer Monday and around 700 supervisors will vote on the deal Tuesday.
Chuquicamata's 7,000 miners went on strike for 10 days last year after scheduled wage talks broke down.
The mine, the largest of Codelco's four mining divisions, produced 632,000 tonnes of fine copper last year.
